intro: Mendoncella negrensis, commonly known as the Negrensis bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the rainy season. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
